item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. New 2GB Raspberry Pi 5 has 33% smaller die, 30% idle power savings (27 points | 1 comment)
2. OpenAI is shockingly good at unminifying code (560 points | 212 comments)
3. Show HN: Low Cost Mini PCs (387 points | 187 comments)
4. Launch HN: Patchwork (YC W24) – Automatically add structured logs to your code (16 points | discuss)

6. Air Con: $1697 for an on/off switch (1529 points | 385 comments)
7. From Julia to Rust (37 points | 12 comments)
8. How I learned to stop worrying and love userspace networking (65 points | 8 comments)
9. Farewell Pandas, and thanks for all the fish (118 points | 53 comments)
10. Raspberry Pi Pico does line rate 100M Ethernet (7 points | discuss)
11. Show HN: Homemade Automated Solar Concentrator (153 points | 39 comments)
12. Chrome Is Entrenching Third-Party Cookies That Will Mislead Users (11 points | 1 comment)

14. A Java Language Cumulative Feature Rollup (14 points | 2 comments)

22. How Intel Missed the iPhone: The XScale Era (65 points | 45 comments)
23. Two Dots Too Many (2008) (50 points | 22 comments)
24. Windmill (YC S22) Hiring Rust and TypeScript Eng #3 in Paris ( | hide)
25. Docusaurus – Build optimized websites quickly, focus on your content (137 points | 35 comments)
26. Firefox rolls out Total Cookie Protection by default to more users (2022) (94 points | 26 comments)
27. Exploiting column chunks for faster ingestion and lower memory use (6 points | 2 comments)
28. Can solar costs keep shrinking? (42 points | 40 comments)
29. This behavior is by design (17 points | 11 comments)
30. Deterministic Replay of QEMU Emulation (135 points | 31 comments)
